name: NotificationParams
summary: Dictionary object of parameters used to create a notification using scheduleLocalNotification.

properties.name: alertAction
properties.summary: Alert button text ('Open', by default) or home text ('Press Home to unlock', by default) to display.

properties.name: alertLaunchImage
properties.summary: Image to display instead of Default.png when launching the application.

properties.name: category
properties.summary: String identifier of category of actions to be displayed for an interactive notification.

properties.name: date
properties.summary: Date and time for the notification to occur.

properties.name: identifier
properties.description: This property is required in iOS 10+ and will fallback to a generated UUID-string if not set. It is recommended to manage the identifier yourself, but you can also get the generated UUID by accessing via the "userInfo.id" field for parity with older iOS versions.

properties.name: region
properties.summary:
Region the notification will be triggered in. Allowed parameter are:

  • latitude: Latitude of the location center, in decimal degrees (required).
  • longitude: Longitude of the location center, in decimal degrees (required).
  • triggersOnce: Whether or not the notification will only fire once (optional, default: true).

properties.name: repeat
properties.summary: Interval to repeat the notification. One of weekly, daily, yearly, monthly.

properties.name: sound
properties.summary: Path to the sound file to play when notification occurs, relative to the Resources folder.

properties.name: summaryArgument
properties.summary: The string the notification adds to the category's summary format string.

properties.name: summaryArgumentCount
properties.summary: The number of items the notification adds to the category's summary format string.

properties.name: timezone
properties.summary: Timezone of the date configured for the notification. If not set, the system timezone is used.

properties.name: userInfo
properties.summary: Data to pass to the application with the notification event.
